meanings.definition: The act or process of dulling or blunting.
meanings.sent1: After a long day of work, he experienced hebetation of his mind.
meanings.sent2: The hebetation of the knife's blade made it difficult to cut through the tough meat.
meanings.sent3: The hebetation of the pencil tip led to a series of dull drawings.
meanings.sent4: The hebetation of her senses in the foggy morning made everything seem distant and muted.
meanings.sent5: The hebetation of the old scissors made them useless for cutting paper.

meanings.definition: The state of being dull or lethargic.
meanings.sent1: His hebetation after a heavy meal made him want to take a nap.
meanings.sent2: The hebetation of the student's mind was evident in his slow responses during the test.
meanings.sent3: The hebetation of the cat on a lazy Sunday afternoon was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The hebetation of the city streets in the early morning gave them a deserted feel.
meanings.sent5: The hebetation of the old computer system frustrated the employees trying to get work done.
